General course objectives:
General course objectives
To give the participants solid knowledge of the basic principles of data science and compression and methods for data compression e.g. for image communication. To enable the students to implement and evaluate data analysis and compression algorithms.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
implement a data compression or analysis scheme
simulate data compression encoding and decoding
calculate and evaluate the performance factor
calculate and evaluate the quality of decoded or reconstructed data objectively and subjectively
analyse and explain an entropy estimate, e.g in relation to a code length
explain decorrelation of data for analysis and compression
explain quantization of a data representation
explain the entropy concept, e.g. for coding
Content:
Introduction to the basic principles and methods for data science and compression incl. basics of information theory as entropy, cross entropy and mutual information (MI). The entropy is a measure of information and mutual information a measure of shared information. This includes entropy coding by Huffman and arithmetic coding, decorrelation by prediction or transformation to the frequency domain and quantization of data for lossy coding and representation.
Some examples of data for compression and analysis are presented, eg. coding and analysis of: Data strings, Images in the frequency domain (DCT and wavelets - JPEG image coding specifications), Audio signals, and video as image sequences. Application areas include coding and analysis of images, video and data from drones, as well as high-quality images, e.g. for internet applications.
Midway, the students choose a project within the areas presented.
